initial.title: Step 0: Initial State
initial.description:
SJF with Priority is a PREEMPTIVE scheduling algorithm.

Core Rules:
- Higher priority can preempt lower priority
- Same priority: SHORTER ORIGINAL burst can preempt
- Uses ORIGINAL burst for comparison (NOT remaining!)
- Tie-breakers: Priority → Original Burst → Arrival → ID

Our problem set has {num_processes} processes: {process_list}.

show_arrivals.title: Step 1: Mark Arrival Times (RS)
show_arrivals.description:
Mark when each process arrives.

Arrival order: {arrival_order}

RS markers show when processes enter the ready queue.
IMPORTANT: This algorithm uses ORIGINAL burst for ALL comparisons!

first_block.title: Step {step}: Process {process_id} begins (P={priority}, Burst={burst})
first_block.description:
At t={current_time}, selecting from ready queue...

Ready: {ready_list}
Sorted by Priority (desc) → Original Burst (asc)

Selected: {process_id} (Priority={priority}, Original Burst={burst})

continue_block.title: Step {step}: Process {process_id} continues (t={current_time})

preemption_priority.title: Step {step}: PREEMPTION! {new_process} interrupts {old_process}
preemption_priority.description:
Process {new_process} (Priority={new_priority}) arrives at t={current_time}!

{old_process} (Priority={old_priority}) is preempted - LOWER priority.

{old_process} returns to ready queue with {old_remaining} blocks remaining.
Note: {old_process}'s original burst ({old_burst}) stays constant for future comparisons.

preemption_burst.title: Step {step}: PREEMPTION! {new_process} interrupts {old_process}

no_preemption.title: Step {step}: {new_process} arrives (no preemption)
no_preemption.description:
Process {new_process} (P={new_priority}, Burst={new_burst}) arrives at t={current_time}.

Current: {current_process} (P={current_priority}, Burst={current_burst})

No preemption - {reason}
{new_process} waits in ready queue.

process_complete.title: Step {step}: Process {process_id} completes!

final.title: Step {step}: Final Solution
